contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''General Officer Commanding''' ('''GOC''') is the usual title given in the armies of [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] (and some other) nations to a [[general officer]] who holds a command appointment. Thus, a general might be the GOC [[II Corps (United Kingdom)|II Corps]] or GOC [[British 7th Armoured Division|7th Armoured Division]]. A general officer heading a particularly large or important command may be called a '''General Officer Commanding-in-Chief''' ('''GOC-in-C'''). The equivalent term for air force officers is [[Air Officer Commanding]] (AOC). [[Category:Military ranks]] {{UK-mil-stub}}
